Package ohos.agp.window.dialog

Class ToastDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.dialog.BaseDialog
      • ohos.agp.window.dialog.CommonDialog
        • ohos.agp.window.dialog.ToastDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDialog

    public class ToastDialog
extends CommonDialog
    Provides a toast dialog box above a window to notify simple feedback for an operation.

    The toast dialog box is not clickable and it disappears automatically.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • setText

        public ToastDialog setText​(String text)
        Sets the text content in the dialog.

        It cannot be empty except in custom scenarios.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text content in the dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • setComponent

        @Deprecated
public ToastDialog setComponent​(DirectionalLayout component)
        Deprecated. Use setComponent(ohos.agp.components.Component) instead.
        Sets the customized component to use in the dialog.

        This is a ComponentContainer that encapsulates the customized component to be displayed.

        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the customized ComponentContainer.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • setComponent

        public ToastDialog setComponent​(Component component)
        Sets the customized component to use in the dialog.

        This is a ComponentContainer that encapsulates the customized component to be displayed.

        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the customized ComponentContainer.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • getComponent

        public Component getComponent​()
        Obtains the content of the dialog.

        The obtained object is a ComponentContainer, which encapsulates the component to display.

        Returns:
        Returns the content displayed in the dialog.

      • cancel

        public void cancel​()
        Cancels the current ToastDialog.

        This dialog will not be destroyed but will not be displayed after execution.

      • setAlignment

        public ToastDialog setAlignment​(int gravity)
        Sets the dialog alignment mode.

        A toast dialog has many alignment modes, for example, bottom alignment.

        Overrides:
        setAlignment in class BaseDialog
        Parameters:
        gravity - Indicates the alignment mode to use.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • setOffset

        public ToastDialog setOffset​(int offsetX,
                             int offsetY)
        Sets the display position offset for the dialog.

        This is the offset compared with the default alignment mode.

        Overrides:
        setOffset in class BaseDialog
        Parameters:
        offsetX - Indicates the offset of the X axis.
        offsetY - Indicates the offset of the Y axis.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

        Sets the size of a toast dialog.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the width to set.

        Returns:

      • setAutoClosable

        public ToastDialog setAutoClosable​(boolean closable)
        Description copied from class: BaseDialog
        Sets whether to enable automatic close a dialog box.

        If automatic close is enabled, a dialog box automatically closes when touching or clicking a position outside the dialog box.

        Overrides:
        setAutoClosable in class BaseDialog
        Parameters:
        closable - Indicates whether to enable automatic close of the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

        Overrides:
        setDuration in class BaseDialog
        Parameters:
        ms - Indicates the duration for automatic close of the Dialog instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().
